channel.title: Prayer and Magic tab sprites
channel.description:
I've got this issue with my client where the sprites for all prayers and spells (In both prayer books and all 3 spellbooks) where even if you have the level and runes required to use the spell/prayer, the sprite is still faded. The spells/prayers are usable, but you would have no way of knowing if you we're able to use them or not without hovering your mouse over them and checking the requirements. This worked on my old client, but the renaming is different, and I suck at client work anyways, so I wasn't able to figure it out.
Does anyone know how to fix it? [s]I believe it's a Galkon's Refactored client, but I'm not too sure. The only thing I can tell you is that the variables in ItemDef seem to match most renamed clients, which wasn't true for the PI client I used to have.[/s] Jk, it's definitely a Galkon's Refactored client.
Rep for help.

item.title: Prayer and Magic tab sprites
item.dc:creator: @revengr revengr
item.description:
@revengr wrote:

I’ve got this issue with my client where the sprites for all prayers and spells (In both prayer books and all 3 spellbooks) where even if you have the level and runes required to use the spell/prayer, the sprite is still faded.
The spells/prayers are usable, but you would have no way of knowing if you we’re able to use them or not without hovering your mouse over them and checking the requirements.
This worked on my old client, but the renaming is different, and I suck at client work anyways, so I wasn’t able to figure it out.

Does anyone know how to fix it?
I believe it’s a Galkon’s Refactored client, but I’m not too sure.
The only thing I can tell you is that the variables in ItemDef seem to match most renamed clients, which wasn’t true for the PI client I used to have.
Jk, it’s definitely a Galkon’s Refactored client.

Rep for help.

Read full topic
